timeline.message:
ISPN-12444 Stream K/V endpoint
* Limit parameter
* Metadata parameter
* Limit parameter included for key streaming

ISPN-12444 Stream K/V endpoint

* Limit parameter
* Metadata parameter
* Limit parameter included for key streaming

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            |Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
          
          
            
            |Specifies the maximum number of keys to retrieve using an InputStream. A negative value retrieves all keys. The default value is `-1`.
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            |Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.
          
          
            
            |Includes metadata for each entry in the response. The default value is `false`.
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            |Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
          
          
            
            |Specifies the maximum number of keys to include in the response. A negative value retrieves all keys. The default value is `-1`.
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `key` The key of the entry.
          
          
            
            * `key` The key for the entry.
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
 |OPTIONAL
 |Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
 |===
 
+{brandname} provides a JSON response such as the following:
+
+[source,json,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+include::json_examples/rest_caches_all_entries.json[]
+----
+
+* `key` The key of the entry.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `lifespan` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not lifespan time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `lifespan` Entry lifespan, in milliseconds, or `-1` if not specified. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
 |OPTIONAL
 |Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
 |===
 
+{brandname} provides a JSON response such as the following:
+
+[source,json,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+include::json_examples/rest_caches_all_entries.json[]
+----
+
+* `key` The key of the entry.
+* `value` The value of the entry.
+* `lifespan` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not lifespan time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `maxIdle` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not maxIdle time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `maxIdle` Maximum idle time, in milliseconds, for the entry or `-1` if not specified. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `created` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not created time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `created` Time the entry was created. Returns a value of `-1` if there is no creation time. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `lastUsed` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not last used time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `lastUsed` The last time an operation was performed on the entry. Returns a value of `-1` if there is no last used time. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `expireTime` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not expiration time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `expireTime` The entry expiration time in milliseconds. A value of `-1` means the stream does not include entry metadata.

timeline.bodyText: Same as the comment before, I'd rather apply the limit in the stream itself
timeline.author: gustavonalle

timeline.bodyText:
Same wording needs to be changed in those descriptions. E.g.:

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `expireTime` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not expiration time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
          
          
            
            * `expireTime` Value in milliseconds, or -1 if the entry does not expire. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
timeline.author: gustavonalle
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies if each entry should contain the metadata. The default value is `false`.
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to be streamed. A negative value will retrieve the keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
 |OPTIONAL
 |Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
 |===
 
+{brandname} provides a JSON response such as the following:
+
+[source,json,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+include::json_examples/rest_caches_all_entries.json[]
+----
+
+* `key` The key of the entry.
+* `value` The value of the entry.
+* `lifespan` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not lifespan time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
+* `maxIdle` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not maxIdle time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
+* `created` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not created time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
+* `lastUsed` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not last used time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.
+* `expireTime` Value in milliseconds. -1 indicated not expiration time. The value will not be present if metadata is parameter is `false`.

replies.bodyText: What exactly is the expire time for an entry?

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            * `expireTime` The entry expiration time in milliseconds. A value of `-1` means the stream does not include entry metadata.
          
          
            
            * `expireTime` Time when the entry expires or `Never` for immortal entries. Returns a value of `-1` unless you set metadata="true".
timeline.author: oraNod
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -318,11 +318,54 @@ GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=keys
 |===
 |Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
 
-|`batch-size`
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to retrieve using an InputStream. A negative value retrieves all keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
+|===
+
+[id='rest_v2_get_entries']
+= Retrieving All Entries from Caches
+Invoke `GET` requests to retrieve all the entries in a cache in JSON format.
+
+[source,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+GET /rest/v2/caches/{cacheName}?action=entries
+----
+
+.Request Parameters
+
+|===
+|Parameter |Required or Optional |Value
+
+|`metadata`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Includes metadata for each entry in the response. The default value is `false`.
+|`limit`
+|OPTIONAL
+|Specifies the maximum number of keys to include in the response. A negative value retrieves all keys. The default value is `-1`.
+|`batch`
 |OPTIONAL
 |Specifies the internal batch size when retrieving the keys. The default value is `1000`.
 |===
 
+{brandname} provides a JSON response such as the following:
+
+[source,json,options="nowrap",subs=attributes+]
+----
+include::json_examples/rest_caches_all_entries.json[]
+----
+
+* `key` The key for the entry.
+* `value` The value of the entry.
+* `lifespan` Entry lifespan, in milliseconds, or `-1` if not specified. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".
+* `maxIdle` Maximum idle time, in milliseconds, for the entry or `-1` if not specified. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".
+* `created` Time the entry was created. Returns a value of `-1` if there is no creation time. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".
+* `lastUsed` The last time an operation was performed on the entry. Returns a value of `-1` if there is no last used time. No value is returned unless you set metadata="true".
+* `expireTime` The entry expiration time in milliseconds. A value of `-1` means the stream does not include entry metadata.
